Notes: FACT. Confirmed in decomposition scope ledger: SOW-0500 maps to PKG-005 / DEL-05-01_Optional-Wash-Bay.

Notes: FACT. Confirmed in decomposition objectives table: OBJ-010 supported by DEL-05-01.

TargetName: Public Works Shop Bays Workshop & Support Spaces
Statement: Base building PW bay area layout must be sufficiently developed to establish fourth bay location for wash bay concept
EvidenceQuote: Base building concept is sufficiently developed to understand the Public Works bay area layout
Notes: FACT. Wash bay replaces fourth PW bay; requires PW bay layout from DEL-02-03.

Statement: RFP Appendix B (Public Works Critical Design Equipment List) must be reviewed to confirm fleet vehicle dimensions for wash bay sizing
SourceRef: Procedure > Prerequisites > For Deliverable Production; Procedure > Step 1
EvidenceQuote: Public Works Critical Design Equipment List (RFP Appendix B) reviewed to confirm fleet vehicle dimensions
Notes: FACT. Fleet vehicle dimensions from Appendix B are required input for bay sizing (REQ-WB-05).

Statement: Site civil works drainage design required to coordinate wash bay effluent tie-ins and interceptor/holding tank siting
SourceRef: Procedure > Prerequisites > For Post-Award; Guidance > Drainage and Effluent Management
EvidenceQuote: Site civil works design sufficiently advanced to coordinate drainage and effluent tie-ins
Notes: FACT. Guidance explicitly states interceptor/holding tank siting must be coordinated with site civil works (PKG-003).

TargetLocation: AEP / Town of Penhold environmental advisor
Statement: Environmental regulatory requirements must be confirmed with AEP or Town environmental advisor for wash bay effluent management approach
EvidenceQuote: Environmental regulatory requirements confirmed with AEP or Town's environmental advisor
Notes: FACT. Multiple sources (Procedure prerequisites; Specification REQ-WB-11; Guidance) require AEP/Town confirmation for effluent disposal.

Statement: AHJ pre-consultation required for wash bay plumbing drainage and building permit scope
EvidenceQuote: AHJ pre-consultation completed for wash bay elements (plumbing drainage building permit scope)
Notes: FACT. Procedure explicitly lists AHJ pre-consultation as prerequisite; DEL-01-04 manages permitting/AHJ coordination.

Statement: Base building mechanical design provides bay sumps (SOW-0214) and water fill stations that interface with wash bay mechanical requirements
SourceRef: Specification > Out of Scope; Guidance > Interaction with Base Building
EvidenceQuote: Base-scope shop bays and their sumps (separate deliverables under PKG-002)
Notes: FACT. Wash bay inherits base bay sump (Addendum 03 s1.8) from DEL-02-05; incremental containment is option scope.

Statement: Wash bay HVAC and ventilation design inputs are produced as a handover to the mechanical discipline lead (DEL-02-05)
EvidenceQuote: Document as a design input for the mechanical discipline lead
Notes: FACT. Procedure Step 3a explicitly creates an HVAC design input memo handed to mechanical discipline.

Statement: Wash bay water supply and wastewater disposal connect to site utility stubs (water/wastewater stubbed at site corner per Addendum 03 s1.6)
SourceRef: Datasheet > Attributes > Water supply; Datasheet > Attributes > Wastewater/drainage
EvidenceQuote: site water stubbed at site corner per Addendum 03 s1.6; wash bay-specific supply sizing TBD
Notes: FACT. Wash bay water supply and wastewater disposal depend on site utility distribution (Addendum 03 s1.6).
